meanings.definition: A form of dialogue in which two characters speak alternate lines of verse.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the actors engaged in stichomythies, taking turns speaking lines.
meanings.sent2: The stichomythies between the characters added intensity to the scene.
meanings.sent3: The stichomythies between the friends sounded like a poetic game of tennis.
meanings.sent4: Their stichomythies were like a rhythmic dance of words on stage.
meanings.sent5: The stichomythies made the dialogue feel like a poetic duel.

meanings.definition: The rapid exchange of short, clipped lines between characters in a play.
meanings.sent1: During the intense scene, the actors engaged in stichomythies to convey urgency.
meanings.sent2: The stichomythies in the play kept the audience engaged and on edge.
meanings.sent3: The stichomythies between the siblings sounded like a verbal race.
meanings.sent4: Their stichomythies were like a verbal ping-pong match.
meanings.sent5: The stichomythies created a fast-paced rhythm in the dialogue.
